alert.note: Alert for Craighead (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 21 at 2:37AM CDT until April 22 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of East Arkansas, including the following counties, Craighead and Poinsett. * WHEN...Until 345 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 235 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Rainfall rates between 1 and 1.5 inches per hour are expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jonesboro, Harrisburg, Bay, Weiner, Cash, Egypt, Waldenburg, Greenfield, Otwell, Gilkerson, Valley View, Cary, Herman, Dryden, Winesburg, Risher, Apt, Pitts, Uno and Hergett. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
